intro: Euphrasia curta subsp. uechtritziana, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Alps. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. It has hairy leaves and a compact growth habit, which helps it survive in harsh environments. This subspecies is valued for its medicinal properties and is often found in alpine meadows.
